title: Software Architect
tagLine: Over 20 years in App Dev. Action, Results, & Growth Oriented. Tenacious & Adaptive. Professional & Humane.

jobs.title: sr developer
details: CONTRIBUTOR<ul>

• Re-engaged with prior team, Asset Management Production/Release Support, to build out custom release management Jira integrated utility hosted in VMWare Tanzu using C#, ASP.Net Core 3.1, Blazor, and SQL Server.
• Refined and managed an MVP backlog with a group of interested stakeholders.
• Rough, Kanaban style backlog management in Jira.
MENTOR<ul>
• Hosted daily working sessions with a junior engineer to advance their capabilities and empower them to contribute on the project.

jobs.title: Sr Manager
details: <ul>
• Using Azure [ServiceBus, DevOps, Functions, Sites, AppInsights, ARM Templates, KeyVault, and CLI], GitHub, and Angular to enhance airline discount management software.
• Develop and support .Net Core 3.1 APIs hosted in OpenShift Kubernetes containers. Used Visual Studio Pro & Code, GitHub and Jenkins DevOps tooling; Splunk for operational log tracing.
• Used Jira for work item tracking. Confluence for documentation.

jobs.title: full-stack developer
details: <ul>
• Developed chat component for shipping & logistics software. Leveraged Twilio, SQL Server, ASP.Net MVC (.Net 4.8), Kendo MVVM, and Azure DevOps (Git & Pipelines)
• Introduced Unit Testing, Dapper ORM, query resource files, and AutoMapper

jobs.title: sr developer
details: CONTRIBUTOR <ul>
• Modernized ASP.Net 4.5.2 app on IIS to .Net Core (3.1) on PCF. Refactored hastily written procedural pattern into OOP with DDD. Applied async/await patterns
• Leveraged enterprise SSO for Authn/Authz • REST API and Microservice Development with ASP.Net Core (2.1) and RabbitMQ
• DevOps with Atlassian (BitBucket, Bamboo), PowerShell, and Pivotal Cloud
• Veracode/CWE remediation • ETL Processing with SQL Server [OLTP, Agent, Service Broker] and Informatica
• Test-Automation with Zephyr, .Net, and PostMan
• Refined and managed BAU operations and backlog with Atlassian suite (Jira, Confluence)
LEADER <ul>
• Unit Test Champion
• Quality Champion with SonarQube and SonarLint
• Coach teammates and screen candidates on C# and SOA
<li>Evolved Release Documentation Automation with AngularJS and Atlassian API Integration<ul>
• Reduced release errors and increased reporting fidelity

jobs.title: Principal Consultant
details: <ul>
• DevOps with GitLab, Jenkins, Docker, and Kubernetes to telecommunications supply chain software
• Designed CI/CD Pipelines. Instantiated Operations Posture with ASP Middleware and Splunk
• Microservice Development with .Net Core (2.2) and Angular (7) on CentOS

jobs.title: Tech Lead, Architect
details: ARCHITECTURE <ul>
• Distributed N-Tier design across an array of products and practices
• Coding, structure, and ALM guidance
• Advise Business and IT stakeholders on opportunities and risks
• Pursue architectural congruity across division and enterprise
• Applied an ESB to stabilize, defragment, and refine existing SOAs
• Internal enterprise R&D community member, API small group
• Operational inventory and stability, Dev-Prod
DEVELOPMENT / OPERATIONS <ul>

• Build and Run support for security (Veracode/CWE remediation, Authentication/Authorization) , mission critical coding, and configuration management in Web (Angular 6), Windows (IIS, Services, MSMQ), SQL Server, and .Net (Core, Full)
• Quality Champion with SonarQube and SonarLint
• Automated configuration management tasks with PowerShell
• Originated first ASP.Net MVC/knockout.js VM/EF project in organization
• Created Aspects (AOP) for performance, logging, and feature toggling
• Introduced IoC and DI patterns to mission critical software
• Built asynchronous batch data processor leveraging .Net TPL assets
• Contributed features for ASP.Net WebForms and MVC applications
• Enterprise CI/CD practices and tooling committee member
• Revolutionized delivery repeatability and quality with Build automation
• Refactored shared class libraries from Visual Studio project references to separate solutions and applied NuGet package publication to them
LEADER<ul>
• Manage direct reports (and consultants)
• Mentor associates on development and delivery
• Interoffice travel for guidance and collaboration
• Chaired divisional architecture focus group
• Interviewed IT candidates for multiple offices
• Lead multiple development teams
<li>Coached and mastered first divisional Scrum team <ul>
• Delivered internal application to offshore call centers in less than nine months with two-three developers. Resulted in ~3.5 minutes avg. call time reduction
• Divisional adoption now complete, success garnered corporate exec approval, influencing corporate practices
